verses.verse: Therefore laying aside all desires to injure others, all types of deceit and hypocrisies, all types of envy, and all forms of evil speaking.
As newborn babies, desire the sincere milk of the word so you may grow by it,
if you have experienced that the Lord is gracious.
You came to the Lord [as to] a living stone, truly rejected by people but chosen by God [and] precious.
You also, as living stones, are built into a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer spiritual sacrifices that are acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
That is why it is contained in the scripture, "Behold, I set a chief cornerstone in Zion that is chosen and precious. He who believes in him will not be ashamed.
Therefore to you who believe, [he is] precious, but to those who refuse to believe, the stone which the builders rejected is made the cornerstone,
a stumbling stone, and a rock that offends, these stumble at the word refusing to believe, into which they were set.

But you [are] a holy generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a special purchased people, so that you proclaim the praises of the one who has called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
At one time you were not [his] people, but now [are] God's people, who had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.
Dearly beloved, I beg [you] as sojourners and foreigners hold yourself back from fleshly lusts which war against the soul.
Have your behavior virtuous among the heathen, so that in the course of slandering you as being evildoers, they may by the virtuous deeds, which they observe, glorify God on the day of visitation.
Submit to every regulation of man, whether from the king, as supreme,
or from governors, or those sent by him for the punishment of evildoers or for the praise of those who do well.
For doing so is God's will, that by doing what is right you may put to silence the ignorance of foolish people.
[Living] as freeborn, yet not using [your] freedom as a cover for evil but as servants of God.
Honor all. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the king.
Servants, obey [your] masters with total respect, not only to the good and gentle but also to the surly ones.
For this is acceptable if someone because of a godly conscience endures grief, suffering unjustly.
For what honor is there when you are beaten up for your wrongdoings and take it patiently? But when you do something that is good and suffer, then take it patiently, that is acceptable with God.
For you were called into this, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example so that you should follow in his steps.
He committed no sin, neither was deceit ever found in his speech.
When he was verbally abused, he did not verbally abuse in return. When he suffered, he did not threaten but committed it to him who judges righteously.
[Christ] by himself [and] on his own body carried our sins on the wooden cross that we, now dead to sins, should live for righteousness. By his bruises, you were healed.
For you were like sheep wandering away but now have come back to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls.
